featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: Data source identification

featureDescription.name: questionId
featureDescription.description: ID of the question (specific to data source)

featureDescription.name: questionType
featureDescription.description: Type of question; "factoid", "list" or something else...; of course, this may be empty

featureDescription.name: questionText
featureDescription.description: Text of question; redundant to QuestionCAS sofa, but useful in the final pipeline stages

featureDescription.name: answerPattern
featureDescription.description: PCRE matching a valid answer; of course, this may be empty if the answer is unknown beforehand

featureDescription.name: procBeginTime
featureDescription.description: Time of processing start (as returned by System.currentTimeMillis()), for measuring answering speed

featureDescription.name: passE_scored
featureDescription.description: PassExtract statistics: Number of scored passages

featureDescription.name: passE_gsscored
featureDescription.description: PassExtract statistics: Number of scored passages that match answerPattern

featureDescription.name: passE_picked
featureDescription.description: PassExtract statistics: Number of picked passages

featureDescription.name: passE_gspicked
featureDescription.description: PassExtract statistics: Number of picked passages that match answerPattern

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.GSAnswer
typeDescription.description: Gold Standard answer (for benchmarking; there may be multiple for list questions)

featureDescription.name: text
featureDescription.description: The possible answer text.

featureDescription.name: base
featureDescription.description: The corresponding token.

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.Focus
typeDescription.description: Question Focus; e.g. in "What site did Lindbergh begin his flight from?", "site" is the focus.

featureDescription.name: base
featureDescription.description: The corresponding token/constituent/dependency/NamedEntity/...

featureDescription.name: token
featureDescription.description: The corresponding token.

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.Subject
typeDescription.description: Question Subject; e.g. in "What site did Lindbergh begin his flight from?", "Lindbergh" is the subject. It might be the sentence NSUBJ, but also e.g. the object as in "Who painted 'Sunflowers'?" - 'Sunflowers'. Note that this is typically *not* a single token but a constituent, e.g. for "When is Fashion week in NYC?" it is "Fashion week", not "week".

featureDescription.name: base
featureDescription.description: The corresponding token/constituent/dependency/NamedEntity/...

featureDescription.name: token
featureDescription.description: The corresponding token.

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.Clue
typeDescription.description: Question Clue. A collection of clues is what supports search for answer-bearing passages. This is a base type that is never directly instantiated, though; subtypes representing various kinds of clues are.

featureDescription.name: base
featureDescription.description: The corresponding token/constituent.

featureDescription.name: weight
featureDescription.description: The more specific, selective or reliable the clue is, the higher weight it should get. Baseline weight is 1.0.

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: Text of the clue. Mostly, this is the same as getCoveredText() output, but some clues may expand or contract abbreviations, or in case of synsets or redirects, the name of the concept may be different (e.g. Wikipedia page title; "spacecraft" is covered, but an additional clue for "spaceship" is generated).

featureDescription.name: isReliable
featureDescription.description: Whether the clue label is reliable, i.e. can be used as a _required_ term during a search query.

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.ClueToken
typeDescription.description: Clue based on interesting-looking tokens (e.g. nouns). These are the weakest form of clues, just as circumstantial evidence.

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.CluePhrase
typeDescription.description: Clue based on interesting-looking sub-phrases (e.g. noun constituents). These are also very weak clues.

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.ClueSV
typeDescription.description: Clue based on SV (selection verb). Helpful but not crucial (esp. not for document titles).

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.ClueNE
typeDescription.description: Clue based on NE (named entity). Basically a stronger variant of ClueToken/CluePhrase.

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.ClueLAT
typeDescription.description: Clue based on the (nongeneralized) LAT word; this corresponds to the question focus, but transformed to a noun, etc. Often indicates the kind of the result, but may be too generic; e.g. "book", "person", "capital", "height", "time"...

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.ClueSubject
typeDescription.description: Clue based on the question subject. "When was Einstein born?" has SV "born", focus "when", but the subject is "Einstein". This is the most important clue, if it exists. When asking "What is the capital of Laos?", multiple subjects "capital", "Laos" and "capital of Laos" with different tweaks (weight, subclass) will be generated.

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.ClueSubjectNE
typeDescription.description: Clue based on the question subject, indicating that it is a named entity (e.g. "Laos" in "What is the capital of Laos?").

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.ClueSubjectToken
typeDescription.description: Clue based on the question subject, indicating that it is a single token (e.g. "capital" in "What is the capital of Laos?").

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.ClueSubjectPhrase
typeDescription.description: Clue based on the question subject, indicating that it is a full phrase (e.g. "capital of Laos" in "What is the capital of Laos?").

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.ClueSubjectAux
typeDescription.description: Clue based on the question subject's auxiliaries. Sometimes, the subject is not a grammatical subject but its attachment; this then complements it, a less important clue. "What is the name of Holmes' brother?" has subject "brother" and "name" remains a SubjectAux.

typeDescription.name: cz.brmlab.yodaqa.model.Question.ClueConcept
typeDescription.description: Clue representing a concept (identified by corresponding wikipedia title). This is born out of ClueNE or CluePhrase and carries information about the concept (page id and label - title).

featureDescription.name: pageID
featureDescription.description: The id of the wikipedia page (can be fed to solr).

featureDescription.name: bySubject
featureDescription.description: Whether this concept has subdued a ClueSubject.

featureDescription.name: byLAT
featureDescription.description: Whether this concept has subdued a ClueLAT.

featureDescription.name: byNE
featureDescription.description: Whether this concept has subdued a ClueNE.
